value.title: Get and transform data with Power BI
value.excerpt: Get and transform data with Power BI

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Prepare data for analysis with Power BI
value.excerpt: You'll learn how to use Power Query to extract data from different data sources, choose a storage mode, and connectivity type. You'll also learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI before you model your data.

You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 24.

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 01: Welcome and Course Introduction
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Peter Myers (Microsoft Most Valued Professional - Data Platform, and course developer), Chris Finlan (Principal Program Manager), and special guest Paginated Report Bear (Course Morale Manager) welcome and introduce you to the course, its outline and the course demo scenario.  The Power

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices.  Ideas: Power BI Designer for Mac https://ideas.powerbi.com/forums/265200-power-bi-ideas/suggestions/7546645-power-bi-designer-for-mac   Apple Boot Camp https://support.apple.com/boot-camp

value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/

value.title: Build a Slicer Panel in Power BI (2022/2023)
value.excerpt: Let's look at how to build a slicer panel in your Power BI Report! This can help to reduce visuals on the canvas and also make for an app like experience. There are some things to think about though.  For a trip down memory lane, here's Adam's 2019 Slicer Panel Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xy9nmSQeUWg

value.title: Measures vs. calculated columns in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: What are the differences between measures and calculated columns in DAX and Power BI? All the answers in this short video. Do you want to know more? Start with Introducing to DAX free course: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/introducing-dax-video-course/ Go deeper with Mastering DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/mastering-dax-video-course/

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Get started and explore the capabilities of Microsoft Fabric.

topItems.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

topItems.title: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric

topItems.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

topItems.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Handling MULTIPLE fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: You've got multiple fact tables in your Power BI dataset. And, dimension tables for each. Struggling to slice and dice across both? Patrick shows you how to deal with this mess.  Understand star schema and the importance for Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/star-schema  📢 Become
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TnyRsO4NJPc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Model data with Power BI
value.excerpt: Model data with Power BI

topItems.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

topItems.title: Choose a Power BI model framework
topItems.excerpt: Describe Power BI data model frameworks, their benefits and limitations, and features to help optimize your Power BI data models.

topItems.title: Design a data model in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: The process of creating a complicated data model in Power BI is straightforward. If your data is coming in from more than one transactional system, before you know it, you can have dozens of tables that you have to work with. Building a great data model is about simplifying the disarray. A star schema is one way to simplify a data model, and you’ll learn about the terminology and implementation of them in this module. You will also learn about why choosing the correct data granularity is important for performance and usability of your Power BI reports. Finally, you’ll learn about improving performance with your Power BI data models.

topItems.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: DAX Fridays #209: Open orders in DAX | Events in progress & Time intelligence
value.excerpt: In today's video, we are going to go through how to think about Time Intelligence calculations with a specific case: Calculating the number of open orders using DAX.  I read a million years ago a blog post from Gerhard where he explained how to do it and even though we are not going to use the same DAX

value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: A new way to manage gateways in Power BI!!!
topItems.excerpt: We now have a new way to manage gateways within Power BI and it is a much-welcomed update! Adam walks you through the experience to get you ready for it!
